The '''Battle of the Heath of the Sky-roof''' took place during the [[Faring Forth]], the great expedition by the [[Elves]] of [[Tol Eressëa]] for the rescue of their [[Ilkorindi|lost kin]] in the [[Great Lands]], according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in some of the outlines for the continuation of ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.<ref name="Sky">{{LT2|VI}}, outline '''5''', p. 284</ref>

No full, detailed account of the battle is given, as it is only mentioned passingly in the ''Lost Tales''.

== History ==
It took place at the [[Heath of the Sky-roof]], not far from [[Tavrobel]], and was fought between two different groups of [[Men]], following their invasion of Tol Eressëa. It ended in defeat for the Men friendly to the Elves, and the remaining Elves fled over the rivers [[Afros]] and [[Gruir]], hoping to escape the invaders.<ref name="Sky"/>

According to one outline, the Mannish mariner [[Eriol]] witnessed the battle and ultimately fled with the Elves, and wrote the final words of the ''[[Golden Book]]'' in the ruins of Tavrobel.<ref name="High">{{LT2|VI}}, outline '''8''', p. 287</ref>

Following the battle, the last remnants of the Elves of Tol Eressëa and the Great Lands went into hiding, and eventually faded and ceased to be visible to most Men.<ref>{{LT2|VI}}, p. 293</ref>

== Other names ==
The battle was also called the '''''Battle of the High Heath''''',<ref name="High"/> as well as the '''''Battle of the Heaven Roof''''', and the '''''Battle of Dor-na-Dhaideloth'''''.<ref>{{LT2|VI}}, p. 287</ref>
